intro: Zeugites pittieri, commonly known as the Pittier's zeugite, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and orange. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to semi-shaded forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
